question: {name1} has {n1} tubes of {color1} paint and {n2} tubes of {color2} paint. {name2} has a fraction of {frac1} as many tubes of {color1} paint as {name1}, and {mult1} times as many tubes of {color2} paint as {name1}. {name3} has {mult3} times as many tubes of {color3} paint as the combined number of {color1} tubes that {name1} and {name2} have, and {n4} fewer tubes of {color4} paint than the combined number of {color2} tubes that {name1} and {name2} have. How many tubes of paint does {name3} have?
